alert.note: Alert for Banner; Morrill; Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 29 at 7:51PM CST until January 30 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST MONDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 25 to 30 degrees below zero. * WHERE...In Wyoming, Laramie and Goshen Counties including Cheyenne, Pine Bluffs, and Torrington. In Nebraska, Banner, Scotts Bluff, and Morrill counties including Scottsbluff, Alliance, and Bridgeport. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Dangerously cold wind chills could lead to hypothermia and can cause frostbite on exposed skin in 20 minutes or less. * Additional Impacts...Occasional light snow will result in additional snowfall accumulations of a dusting to half inch, mainly along the higher ridges.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, including a knit hat and mittens. A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frostbite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors, make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
